para.emphasis: Leading-edge projection-based reduced order models (pROMs) for dynamical systems in science and engineering.

detaileddescription.para: You landed on the documentation of the C++ library, which is one component of the Pressio project.

sect1.title: In a nutshell
sect1.para: Pressio provides model reduction functionalities applicable to any system expressible as \[ \frac{d \boldsymbol{y}}{dt} = \boldsymbol{f}(\boldsymbol{y},t; ...) \] where $y$ is the full-order model (FOM) state, $f$ is the FOM velocity, and $t$ is time.

We leverage this simple, expressive mathematical framework as a pivotal design choice to enable a minimal application programming interface (API) that is natural to dynamical systems. To use Pressio, you only need to create an adapter class to expose the right-hand-side of your system and optionally the action of its Jacobian.
